column1: The Gate of Bronze was the third of the Seven Gates of Gondolin
column2: in shape a wall spanning the Orfalch Echor mounted by three square towers
column3: roofed and "clad" in bright copper.  The double-door hung with shields and bronze plates
column4: wrought with many figures and strange signs.  There were many red lamps along the wall
column5: which made the copper and bronze shine like fire.  The guards of this gate wore red mail
column6: and carried red-bladed axes.  These guards were mostly Sindar of Nevrast.  The gate followed the Gate of Stone and was followed by the Gate of Writhen Iron.
